intro: Lonchocarpus chiapensis, commonly known as the Chiapas thornwood, is a woody legume native to Central America and parts of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive, spiny pods. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are often clustered in racemes. Its root system is known to contain toxic alkaloids, which have been studied for their potential medicinal properties. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes or in ecological restoration projects.
